TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 25-26

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 25-26

div1.p: Recd from Moses Austin four Hundred Dollars in full for a location of land in the Counties of Wythe and Russell of One Hundred Thousand Acres which said land I promis to have Surveyed and returned as soon as Possible the said Austin furnishing money to pay all the expences attending the same such as surveyors fees and other Charges I also promis to survey Twenty five thousand Acres on Clynch as also an entry of said Austins on New River, made by me which has been prevented for the want of money to pay the necessary fees making in all 145000 Ac
100000 for Austin Lauman and Blanchard but in the name of Moses Austin
25 Thousand Acres for M Austin on Clynch
20 do do for do on New River
